posts.cooked:
Hello everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.36.0-beta.1. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta here.

Release notes:

  • This update fixes a bug on macOS Sonoma that prevented screen sharing from working correctly if permission to share the screen had previously been denied — so you no longer need to share your screen with an error message.
  • Filter by Unread now highlights the selected chat, and the list of unread chats will automatically update as new messages arrive or when you catch up in one chat and click on another.

Commit changes: Comparing v7.35.0-beta.1…v7.36.0-beta.1 · signalapp/Signal-Desktop · GitHub

Thanks for being a beta tester!

New Version: 7.36.0-beta.1

59 new commits since 7.35.0-beta.1:

Show commits

  • v7.36.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • Upgrade/remove outdated dependencies [2]

  • Update libsignal to 0.62.0 [3]

  • Handle abort signal in SocketManager [4]

  • Fix pre call info for call links with admin approval [5]

  • Upgrade outdated dependencies [6]

  • Fix animated logo spinner [7]

  • Trim group name and description from group state [8]

  • For outgoing 1:1 calls, start ringing on prering status [9]

  • Add toast when import errors [10]

  • Upgrade sass [11]

  • Update to ringrtc 2.48.7 [12]

  • Allow empty groupExpirationTimerUpdate.updaterAci in backup import [13]

  • Ignore stdout errors when running from console [14]

  • Upgrade outdated dependencies [15]

  • Upgrade rezip-electron to 2.0.1 [16]

  • Update icon assets [17]

  • Improve handling of expireTimerVersion glare [18]

  • Better handling of failed message migration attempts [19]

  • Update backup integration tests to fcd73d83 [20]

  • Stub out speechEvent callback [21]

  • Limit Filter by Unread to non production [22]

  • Fix repeated call messages for timestamp updates [23]

  • Re-hydrate signal protocol caches after import [24]

  • Fix react-contextmenu patch [25]

  • Ensure ESC removes quoted reply when drafting [26]

  • Add missing await in storage service code [27]

  • Release notes for 7.35 [28]

  • Update strings [29]

  • Update DNS fallback [30]

  • Show connecting state before ringing for direct calls [31]

  • Target ES2021 [32]

  • Allow for empty stickerMessage.emoji and quote.authorAci during backup import [33]

  • Improve tap-to-view deletion query [34]

  • Smarter incoming message handling for filter by unread (#9366) [35]

  • Fix lightbox video styles [36]

  • Force relays only if remote user is not a Signal Connection [37]

  • Improve handling of DOE messages in backups [38]

  • Fix service id conversion in import [39]

  • Verify groupId for group changes [40]

  • Fix long call titles overflowing in calls list [41]

  • Disable message insert triggers during backup import [42]

  • Initial logic for release notes [43]

  • fix screenshare crash on OSX 14 [44]

  • Fix transfer archive timeout [45]

  • Test for roundtripping view-once quotes [46]

  • Enable filter by unread on production [47]

  • Highlight the selected conversation when filter by unread is enabled [48]

  • Send alternate numbers to CDSI [49]

  • Deprecate check for versioned expire timer capability [50]

  • Hydrate redux before updating conversations' last messages after import [51]

  • Pin libphonenumber in package-lock.json [52]

  • Ensure long message trimming is unicode-aware [53]

  • Improve backup conversation message request state handling [54]

  • Filter by unread: small improvements and unit tests [55]

  • Fix memory usage by batching syncTasks [56]

  • Release notes for 7.36 [57]

  • Update strings [58]

  • 7.36.0-beta.1 [59]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Desktop v7.35.0-beta.1…v7.36.0-beta.1

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

posts.cooked:
ayumi-signal:

Oops sorry – thank you

No problem! @updates-bot checks every 10 minutes, so the first post can be timed accordingly

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
No fix to the issue where you can’t reselect the compose box after entering an emoji :(

On the other hand thanks so much for adding a connecting state for calls!!!
I have noticed that there doesn’t seem to be a profile icon or anything for this state :)

posts.name: Xashyar
posts.cooked:
updates-bot:

For outgoing 1:1 calls, start ringing on prering status [9]

This has been a long running issue, which is finally being resolved

Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 5.27 release

These are both bugs filed in our internal tracker. We just haven’t gotten to them yet.

The only issue now being, that the contact’s profile is not shown if the outgoing call for whatever reason can’t switch from Connecting... to the Ringing... stage:

image828×980 7.12 KB

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 5.27 release

posts.cooked: Thanks for the feedback on the call connecting state! working on a fix :)

posts.name: Xashyar
posts.cooked:
After inserting a media attachment from clipboard into Signal, It takes endlessly for Signal to render/load the attachment, however this is not reproducible, after removing the drafted attachment, and re-pasting it, the issue goes away.

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.36.0-beta.1/f2775a3be0b85f390415c72f7afdbbfc241c2b8e6d3e57515c404f113398879a.gz

posts.name: Trevor Biller
posts.cooked:
@xayshar thanks for this report.

  • Does this happen for certain file types or is there anything about the files (size, etc.) that might be relevant here? For instance is this only happening with audio files?
  • If you restart the app and then try to paste the attachment, does the issue reproduce?
  • If you attach the file via the in-app button rather than pasting, does the issue still occur?

posts.name: Xashyar
posts.cooked:
For some reason this became irreproducible.

trevor-signal:

Does this happen for certain file types or is there anything about the files (size, etc.) that might be relevant here? For instance is this only happening with audio files?

This only happens with visual media, i.e. video & image, in this case image, which I think when you put any image into clipboard the OS turns it into .PNG?

trevor-signal:
  • If you restart the app and then try to paste the attachment, does the issue reproduce?
  • If you attach the file via the in-app button rather than pasting, does the issue still occur?

not able to reproduce anymore. But I don’t think it would happen via the in-app button, probably something to do with copy-pasting via clipboard.

posts.name: Trevor Biller
posts.cooked: Thanks for this info, and please let us know if you’re able to reproduce it again!

posts.name: Whatnoww
